text: Holvik or Holvika (sometimes spelled Holevik) is a small village on the south side of the island of Vågsøy in Kinn Municipality in Vestland county, Norway. It is situated along the Vågsfjorden, a part of the large Nordfjorden. The village is located about southwest of the town of Måløy and about east of the village of Vågsvåg. The village has a population (2018) of 308 and a population density of . During World War II, Operation Archery took place in and around Holvik and Måløy. ==References== Category:Villages in Vestland Category:Kinn
title: Holvik, Vågsøy
